question: Which amendment of the Constitution of India increased the age of retirement of High Court judges from 60 to 62 years?
explanation: An Act further to amend the Constitution of India. 1. Short title.-This Act may be called the Constitution (Fifteenth Amendment) Act, 1963. "(2A) The age of a Judge of the Supreme Court shall be determined by such authority and in such manner as Parliament may by law provide.".
